summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, requesting assistance in contacting current and former Palm Beach Police Department employees to testify as witnesses in the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutor seeks to authenticate evidence from the 2005 PBPD investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, particularly from a search of his residence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution, referred to as Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirator, in the case United States v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose co-conspirator, Ghislaine Maxwell, is being prosecuted. Evidence from the 2005 PBPD investigation into him is central to the case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, handling the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and requesting assistance in contacting PBPD witnesses.

connections.description: Maxwell is explicitly identified as Epstein's co-conspirator in the criminal case.
The AUSA is handling the prosecution of Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Palm Beach Residence
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department conducted a search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence as part of their 2005 investigation.

events.title: Prosecutor's Request for Witness Assistance
events.description: An AUSA emails an unspecified contact to request help in locating PBPD witnesses for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email from a federal prosecutor preparing for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution plans to introduce evidence gathered during the Palm Beach Police Department's 2005 investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, specifically from a search of his residence in October 2005.
The prosecutor seeks assistance in contacting current and former PBPD employees to authenticate this evidence at trial.
The case is officially titled United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
